metadata.title: CVE-2024-38543 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:lib/test_hmm.c: handle src_pfns and dst_pfns allocation failure Thekcalloc() in dmirror_device_evict_chunk() will return null if the physicalmemory has run out. As a result, if src_pfns or dst_pfns is dereferenced,the null pointer dereference bug will happen. Moreover, the device is goingaway. If the kcalloc() fails, the pages mapping a chunk could not beevicted. So add a __GFP_NOFAIL flag in kcalloc(). Finally, as there is noneed to have physically contiguous memory, Switch kcalloc() to kvcalloc()in order to avoid failing allocations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
